q: No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself.
h:
“No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: It doesn't matter where you are coming from. All that matters is where you are going.
h:
“It doesn't matter where you are coming from. All that matters is where you are going. ” —
Brian Tracy

q: Do all things with love.
h:
“Do all things with love.” —
Og Mandino

q: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
h:
“If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable. ” —
Seneca

q: Becoming a great leader doesn't mean being perfect. it means living with your imperfections.
h:
“Becoming a great leader doesn't mean being perfect. it means living with your imperfections.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: When you consider things like the stars, our affairs don't seem to matter very much, do they?
h:
“When you consider things like the stars, our affairs don't seem to matter very much, do they?” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Our greatest glory is not in never falling but in rising every time we fall.
h:
“Our greatest glory is not in never falling but in rising every time we fall.” —
Confucius

q: Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be.
h:
“Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: To be happy we need something to solve. Happiness is therefore a form of action.
h:
“To be happy we need something to solve. Happiness is therefore a form of action.” —
Mark Manson

q: Make each day a new horizon.
h:
“Make each day a new horizon.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: If he cannot stop the mind that seeks after fame and profit, he will spend his life without finding peace.
h:
“If he cannot stop the mind that seeks after fame and profit, he will spend his life without finding peace.” —
Dogen

q: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
h:
“Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: To a mind that is still, the entire universe surrenders.
h:
“To a mind that is still, the entire universe surrenders.” —
Zhuangzi

q: Nothing ever happened in the past that can prevent you from being present now; and if the past cannot prevent you from being present now, what power does it have?
h:
“Nothing ever happened in the past that can prevent you from being present now; and if the past cannot prevent you from being present now, what power does it have?” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: We cannot change anything unless we accept it.
h:
“We cannot change anything unless we accept it.” —
Carl Jung

q: You have a brain and mind of your own. Use it, and reach your own decisions.
h:
“You have a brain and mind of your own. Use it, and reach your own decisions.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Goodness is the only investment that never fails.
h:
“Goodness is the only investment that never fails.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
h:
“A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.” —
Charles Darwin

q: Fear is a natural reaction to moving closer to the truth.
h:
“Fear is a natural reaction to moving closer to the truth.” —
Pema Chodron

q: Be not glad at the misfortune of another, though he may be your enemy.
h:
“Be not glad at the misfortune of another, though he may be your enemy. ” —
George Washington

q: Successful people tend to become more successful because they are always thinking about their successes.
h:
“Successful people tend to become more successful because they are always thinking about their successes.” —
Brian Tracy

q: We become what we believe.
h:
“We become what we believe.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: I believe that one of life's greatest risks is never daring to risk.
h:
“I believe that one of life's greatest risks is never daring to risk.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Knowledge isn't power until it is applied.
h:
“Knowledge isn't power until it is applied.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: If you are ever the smartest person in the room, you are in the wrong room.
h:
“If you are ever the smartest person in the room, you are in the wrong room.” —
C. Sean McGee

q: There are no ordinary moments.
h:
“There are no ordinary moments.” —
Dan Millman

q: We may not be responsible for the world that created our minds, but we can take responsibility for the mind with which we create our world.
h:
“We may not be responsible for the world that created our minds, but we can take responsibility for the mind with which we create our world.” —
Gabor Mate

q: Do not fight with pigs - you will be smeared in mud but the pig will like it.
h:
“Do not fight with pigs - you will be smeared in mud but the pig will like it.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: The goal is not to show how great you are to others, but how vulnerable you are to yourself.
h:
“The goal is not to show how great you are to others, but how vulnerable you are to yourself.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Character is doing what you don't want to do but know you should do.
h:
“Character is doing what you don't want to do but know you should do.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: The Truth is realized in an instant; the Act is practiced step by step.
h:
“The Truth is realized in an instant; the Act is practiced step by step.” —
Seungsahn

q: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.
h:
“The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.” —
Coco Chanel

q: The traveler sees what he sees. The tourist sees what he has come to see.
h:
“The traveler sees what he sees. The tourist sees what he has come to see.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: Make peace within, and there will be no one who can overcome you. And no one you will wish to overcome.
h:
“Make peace within, and there will be no one who can overcome you. And no one you will wish to overcome.” —
Dan Millman

q: The birth of the mind is the death of the senses.
h:
“The birth of the mind is the death of the senses.” —
Dan Millman

q: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
h:
“Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Success in any endeavor depends on the degree to which it is an expression of your true self.
h:
“Success in any endeavor depends on the degree to which it is an expression of your true self. ” —
Ralph Marston

q: Give a girl the right shoes, and she can conquer the world.
h:
“Give a girl the right shoes, and she can conquer the world.” —
Bette Midler

q: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
h:
“Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Freedom itself demands discomfort.
h:
“Freedom itself demands discomfort.” —
Mark Manson

q: One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.
h:
“One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
h:
“A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.” —
Mark Twain

q: You are always your own best guru, your own best teacher, the answers are always inside you.
h:
“You are always your own best guru, your own best teacher, the answers are always inside you.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: The most important battle is one to conquer yourself.
h:
“The most important battle is one to conquer yourself.” —
Yanni

q: To be fully alive, fully human, and completely awake is to be continually thrown out of the nest.
h:
“To be fully alive, fully human, and completely awake is to be continually thrown out of the nest.” —
Pema Chodron

q: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
h:
“Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Realistic people do not accomplish extraordinary things.
h:
“Realistic people do not accomplish extraordinary things.” —
John Eliot

q: Children are our greatest natural resource.
h:
“Children are our greatest natural resource.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: Facts are the enemy of truth.
h:
“Facts are the enemy of truth. ” —
Miguel de Cervantes

q: Excellence is not an exception, it is a prevailing attitude.
h:
“Excellence is not an exception, it is a prevailing attitude.” —
Colin Powell
